intro: Achyronia albens, commonly known as the white achyronia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, soft pubescence. Achyronia albens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
